intro: Paronychia argyroloba, commonly known as silver-lobed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are succulent, fleshy, and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss.
